intro: Seris hieraciodes, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Seris hieraciodes is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
